head.title: Directive on Telework

ul.li: 1.2This directive replaces the Telework Policy dated December 9, 1999.
2.1This directive is issued pursuant to the same authorities indicated in section 2 of the Policy on People Management.
3.1The objectives indicated in section 3 of the Policy on People Management apply to this directive.
3.2The expected results indicated in section 3 of the Policy on People Management apply to this directive.

6.1This directive applies to the employees and organizations listed in section 6 of the Policy on People Management. For greater certainty, this directive also applies to students, casuals, and part-time workers.

7.1Legislation
Access to Information Act

section.h2: Appendix A: Standard on Telework Agreements

ul.li: A.1.1This standard takes effect on April 1, 2025.
A.2.1This standard provides details on the minimum requirements for a telework agreement as set out in subsection 4.2.9 of the Directive on Telework.

section.h2: Appendix B: Interim Standard on Occasional Travel to a Designated Worksite

ul.li:
B.1This interim standard is a pilot and takes effect on June 1, 2023. It will remain in effect until March 31, 2027.
B.1.1This standard may be amended or rescinded at any time.

B.3Reporting requirements
Organizations monitor and report semi-annually on the application of this authority.

dl.dd: A physical location under the organization’s control. It is not a virtual location or residential address. The employer determines the location of the designated worksite associated with each position.
